		Question: who was saint paul the apostle

Sure, here's the answer to the question:

Saint Paul the Apostle was a Christian apostle who played an important role in the early expansion of Christianity. He was born Saul of Tarsus, in the Roman province of Cilicia, in the first century. He was a Pharisee, a devout Jew, who persecuted Christians. Saul's turning point came when he encountered Jesus of Nazareth on the road to Damascus, and he was converted to Christianity.
